data.title: Prince Tomohito; at 66, cousin of Japanese emperor
data.meta_description: Prince Tomohito, a cousin of Japanese Emperor Akihito, died Wednesday after bouts with various ailments, the Imperial Household Agency said. He was 66.
data.text:
TOKYO — Prince Tomohito, 66, a cousin of Japanese Emperor Akihito, died Wednesday after various ailments, the Imperial Household Agency said.

Prince Tomohito, sixth in line to the Chrysanthemum Throne, died in a Tokyo hospital after organ failures.

The Imperial Household Agency did not give a cause of death, but Prince Tomohito had battled several illnesses, including throat cancer. He had undergone several cancer-related operations since 1991 and was treated for alcoholism in 2007.

Prince Tomohito was the eldest son of Prince Mikasa and Princess Yuriko. Mikasa is the younger brother of Hirohito, the wartime emperor and father of Akihito.

The public fondly called Prince Tomohito ‘‘the bearded prince,’’ referring to his beard, unusual for Japanese royalty.
